title: Evaluation of medication reviews conducted by community pharmacists: a quantitative analysis of documented issues and recommendations
abstract:
What is already known about this subject?\ud
\ud
There is conflicting evidence concerning the potential benefits of pharmacist-led medication review.\ud
Little work has been published on the completeness of medication reviews provided by community pharmacists.\ud
What this study adds\ud
\ud
  The 60 community pharmacists taking part in a large randomized controlled trial showed considerable variation in the completeness of the reviews they recorded for intervention\ud
\ud
 Overall, pharmacists recorded only a minority of the potential issues present in these patients.\ud
\ud
 The frequency with which pharmacists recorded issues was not related to key characteristics or to the number of reviews completed
